item.title: Delhi colleges facing fund crunch urge L-G to intervene

item.title: Bharat Jodo Yatra resumes journey in Uttar Pradesh
item.description: Bharat Jodo Yatra resumes journey in Uttar Pradesh Former party chief Rahul Gandhi reached the village from Delhi ahead of the resumption of the march, Congress Uttar Pradesh unit spokesperson Anshu Awasthi said.

item.title: Bharat Jodo Yatra: क्यों नहीं लगती राहुल गांधी को ठंड? लोगों ने बताया कांग्रेस नेता के भीषण सर्दी में भी टी-शर्ट पहनने का राज
item.description: Bharat Jodo Yatra: क्यों नहीं लगती राहुल गांधी को ठंड? लोगों ने बताया कांग्रेस नेता के भीषण सर्दी में भी टी-शर्ट पहनने का राज क्यों नहीं लगती राहुल गांधी को ठंड?

item.title: Stopped from using mobile, 10-year-old ends life in UP
item.description: Stopped from using mobile, 10-year-old ends life in UP In a shocking incident, a 10-year-old boy allegedly died by suicide in Lucknow after his mother took away the phone and did not let him play online games.

item.title: Uttarakhand: सुशासन दिवस पर CM धामी ने लगवाई पूरे प्रदेश में चौपाल
item.description: Uttarakhand: सुशासन दिवस पर CM धामी ने लगवाई पूरे प्रदेश में चौपाल Uttarakhand: इस वर्ष देश की आजादी के 75 वर्ष पूरे हुए। अब अमृत काल में प्रवेश कर गये हैं.

item.title: “We don’t want India, let it stay abroad .. ” – Controversy over the speech of Lalu party leader Asked My Children To Settle Abroad: Lalu Yadav’s Party Leader Sparks Row
item.description: “We don’t want India, let it stay abroad .. ” – Controversy over the speech of Lalu party leader Asked My Children To Settle Abroad: Lalu Yadav’s Party Leader Sparks Row Lalu Prasad’s party leader Abdul Pari Siddiqui’s statement that he will settle my children abroad has sparked controversy.

item.title: COVID-19: Ahead of New Year, Centre approves Nasal vaccine, to introduce new guidelines
item.description: COVID-19: Ahead of New Year, Centre approves Nasal vaccine, to introduce new guidelines New Delhi: The Centre on Friday approved the Nasal vaccine which will be available in private hospitals.

item.title: Bangladesh 82-2 on 1st morning of 2nd test against India
item.description: Bangladesh 82-2 on 1st morning of 2nd test against India Following its 188-run defeat in the first test at Chattogram, Bangladesh made two changes with batter Mominul Haque and fast bowler Taskin Ahmed replacing Yasir Ali and Ebadot Hossain.

item.title: NIA charge sheets 5 CPI (Maoist) cadres for luring girls
item.description: NIA charge sheets 5 CPI (Maoist) cadres for luring girls The case was initially registered by Peddabayalu Police Station of Visakhapatnam and later re-registered by the NIA in June 2022.

item.title: Nation is always indebted to Armed Forces – PM Modi Tributes on Victory Day
item.description: Nation is always indebted to Armed Forces – PM Modi Tributes on Victory Day New Delhi: “Our nation is always indebted to the armed forces,” PM Modi tweeted on Victory Day.

item.title: Shraddha Murder Case: Aaftab Poonawala seeks bail, files petition in Delhi court
item.description: Shraddha Murder Case: Aaftab Poonawala seeks bail, files petition in Delhi court Aftab Poonawala, the suspect in the murder of Shraddha Walkar, filed a petition at Delhi's Saket Court asking for bail in the case.

item.title: Tawang Clash: तवांग झड़प को लेकर सरकार गंभीर, तीनों सेना प्रमुख के साथ राजनाथ ने बुलाई बैठक, संसद में दे सकते हैं बयान
item.description: Tawang Clash: तवांग झड़प को लेकर सरकार गंभीर, तीनों सेना प्रमुख के साथ राजनाथ ने बुलाई बैठक, संसद में दे सकते हैं बयान Rajnath Singh On Tawang Clash: अरुणाचल के तवांग सेक्टर में 9 दिसंबर को भारत और चीन की सेना के बीच हिंसक झड़प हुई.

item.title: Confusion over Saudi Tourist visa rules: Many Indians land in trouble
item.description: Confusion over Saudi Tourist visa rules: Many Indians land in trouble The multiple-entry tourist visa is valid for one year from the date of issuance, and the permissible period of stay is 90 days.

item.title: Delhi MCD Results 2022: केजरीवाल के पिता बोले- दिल्ली में आएगा 'मफलर मैन', MCD में सबसे पहले AAP करेगी ये काम

item.title: Indian Railways increases train speed to avoid delays due to fog
item.description: Indian Railways increases train speed to avoid delays due to fog Indian Railways is taking various measures to make train services safe from fog in northern parts of the country.

item.title: ‘Don’t know why Congress ignores Shashi Tharoor,’ says NCP leader
item.description: ‘Don’t know why Congress ignores Shashi Tharoor,’ says NCP leader New Delhi: The Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) president of Kerala unit, PC Chacko, raised questions at the Congress asking why the latter is ignoring party leader Shashi Tharoor.

item.description: Mehdi Hasan’s Intimidatory Batting – Bangladesh Defeat India in ‘Tik Tik’ Bangladesh won the match against India by 1 wicket.

item.title: Uttarakhand: उत्तराखंड में भारत-नेपाल बॉर्डर पर तनाव, भारतीय मजदूरों पर सीमापार से की गई पत्थरबाजी

item.title: Drugs Recovered: मुंबई एयरपोर्ट पर DRI ने विदेशी यात्रियों से बरामद की 18 करोड़ रुपये की कोकीन, दो गिरफ्तार

item.description: Bharat Jodo Yatra: Swara Bhaskar, Ex-CM Harish Rawat walks briskly with Rahul Gandhi New Delhi: Former Chief Minister of Uttarakhand Harish Rawat, ex-parliamentarian Prem Chand Guddu and actor Swara Bhaskar joined the ‘Bharat Jodo Yatra’ on Thursday in Madhya Pradesh.

item.description: Second ODI: Indian batting needs fresh approach to save series against New Zealand Hamilton: India would expect a better approach from skipper Shikhar Dhawan and young Shubman Gill in the Powerplay overs when the team clashes with New Zealand in the do-or-die second One-Day International here Sunday.

item.title: PT Usha throws her hat into IOA ring, to fight for president’s post
item.description: PT Usha throws her hat into IOA ring, to fight for president’s post The legendary P T Usha on Saturday announced that she will contest for the post of Indian Olympic Association

item.title: India go down to Aussies despite Akashdeep treble
item.description: India go down to Aussies despite Akashdeep treble Adelaide: Akashdeep Singh’s hat-trick went in vain as India conceded two late goals to lose 4-5 against Australia in the high-scoring first hockey Test of the five-match series here Saturday.

item.title: Collegium system alien to constitution: Law Minister
item.description: Collegium system alien to constitution: Law Minister No institution in a constitutional democracy, including collegium, is perfect: CJI Amid frequent run-ins between the government and the judiciary, Union Law Minister Kiren Rijiju on Friday pitched for fraternal ties between the two pillars of democracy, saying they are like brothers and should not fight each other.

item.title: Top 10 News: रेलवे से निकाले जा रहे भ्रष्ट अधिकारी, गहलोत-पायलट में दिखी दूरियां

item.title: Jacqueline Fernandez arrives at Delhi court in money laundering case involving conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar
item.description: Jacqueline Fernandez arrives at Delhi court in money laundering case involving conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar On Thursday, November 24, actor Jacqueline Fernandez arrived at the Patiala House Court in Delhi in connection with the Rs 200 crore money laundering case involving conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar.

item.description: Hindu Mahasabha plans to rename Meerut after Nathuram Godse, if elected Meerut: The Hindu Mahasabha promised that it will change the name of Meerut to Nathuram Godse Nagar if they comes to power in the upcoming civic polls in Uttar Pradesh.

item.title: Telangana: Concern voiced over BJP’s misuse of central agencies
item.description: Telangana: Concern voiced over BJP’s misuse of central agencies Nalgonda: Leaders of different organizations have in a single voice expressed strong concern over the misuse of central agencies including the Enforcement Directorate (ED) and the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) by the BJP government to target opposition parties.

item.title: Terrorists use dark web to radicalise, funnel crypto currency: Amit Shah
item.description: Terrorists use dark web to radicalise, funnel crypto currency: Amit Shah New Delhi: Union Home Minister Amit Shah Friday said terrorists are spreading radicalism among youth and using elements like dark web and virtual assests to hide their identities.

item.description: West Bengal: A suspected member of Al Qaeda in the Indian subcontinent arrested in Kolkata Kolkata: A suspected member of the terror outfit, Al Qaeda in the Indian subcontinent (AQIS) and Ansarullah Bangla Team, was arrested in West Bengal's South 24 Parganas district, a senior officer told news agency PTI.

item.title: Gujarat: PM Narendra Modi’s meet with Patidar leader sets tongues wagging
item.description: Gujarat: PM Narendra Modi’s meet with Patidar leader sets tongues wagging Ahmedabad: Amid speculation that Prime Minister Narendra Modi may visit influential Patidar organisations on Sardar Patel’s birth anniversary on October 31 in a renewed bid to win over the community, Naresh Patel, Chairman of the Shree Khodaldham Trust, met him at his residence in New Delhi on Saturday evening.

item.title: Gujarat BJP targets Kejriwal over cracker ban in Delhi
item.description: Gujarat BJP targets Kejriwal over cracker ban in Delhi Rajkot: Gujarat BJP chief C R Paatil has hit out at Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal over his government’s decision to completely ban firecrackers in the national capital, and dubbed such people “anti-religious” who were stopping citizens from celebrating their festivals.
